title: How to Make Drawer Liners

steps.headline: Cut the paper to the size that is best for each drawer that you intend to line.
steps.description: It is usually best to allow each liner to fold up a little on each side to aid a good fit and provide a little extra side protection from the sides of the drawers, which are usually painted or varnished.

steps.headline: Fill a spray bottle with warm water.
steps.description: Dip a teabag into the water for three minutes and then remove it.

steps.headline: Add three drops of clove oil and 2 - 4 drops of a favourite essential oil.
steps.description: Good choices include lavender, rosemary, mandarin, orange, nectarine, rose, apricot, lemon or try a mixture of favourite essential oil scents. You will need to experiment with the strength of the scent depending on the oil used.

steps.headline: Spray the solution onto each piece of paper.
steps.description: Allow to dry completely. It helps to be able to do this in a sunny, warm room to speed up the drying process.

steps.headline: Place each piece in your drawers and put clothing back into the drawer over the drawer liners.
